What does the rising #MarketPower of a small group of firms mean for the global economy? 
Watch a replay of the discussion with @KGeorgieva, @vestager, @amyklobuchar, @GuntramWolff, @davidmwessel, and other speakers. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ  https://t.co/d3s1tDQ0O7
IMF financial assistance will support Kenya's reform plans and help meet financing needs. More in our latest #IMFCountryFocus: https://t.co/s1Wgi8dCnb https://t.co/aZHJOgkw6s

Participate in the 2021 IMF-World Bank Spring Meetings from anywhere in the world! 
Join the conversation via #IMFmeetings and watch live our events ▶️ @IMFLive.  https://t.co/YtRGZtxoqM https://t.co/vM0iP2y7Hm

What’s a taxi riding app to do when a pandemic forces everyone to stay home? In Uganda, SafeBoda quickly reinvented itself, connecting confined consumers with retailers and services. More in the latest #FandD: https://t.co/lW8qGLm7Xs #IMFAfrica https://t.co/hoLDmRiIrK

Canada’s carbon price will steadily climb, which puts it on track to have net zero emissions by 2050, providing a model for other large-emitting countries to follow. #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/ZCpivBRQri https://t.co/7063WDwtwV

REPLAY: A discussion with IMF First Deputy Managing Director @gwsokamoto and winners of our 2020 #IMFYouth Fellowship Contest on the green and inclusive recovery and opportunities for youth. https://t.co/5H1GdXnr7m https://t.co/OUY3oEaafS

Canada is steadily ramping up its price on carbon. The government is giving the revenues to people as a tax rebate or through investments, to alleviate the burden of higher energy prices. Read more in #IMFCountryFocus: https://t.co/lTq7S6UFLU https://t.co/bfjRainMVZ

What do #IMFYouth Fellows say about how best to ensure a greener and more inclusive recovery after the pandemic—one that creates more jobs and opportunities for youth? Read about their ideas in #FandD: https://t.co/lYJkj7AUqJ https://t.co/4Bni3U7hdZ

REPLAY: One-on-one conversation with @KGeorgieva and Microsoft President @BradSmi, moderated by MSNBC’s @AliVelshi, exploring how economists and technologists can collaborate to lay the groundwork for a better future. #IMFexchange https://t.co/fFAG5xC5a7

Our new #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva looks at how to ensure that powerful corporations do not benefit at the expense of customers, workers, and governments in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ #MarketPower https://t.co/QTdmXEmavf

The IMF Executive Board praised this week Canada’s commitment to fighting climate change. Beyond the pandemic, it is essential to contribute to the transition to a greener and more equitable economy. https://t.co/0PAeMFPMJP https://t.co/AzHnOt6NYs

Excessive #MarketPower in the hands of a few companies can slow growth, stifle innovation, and hold back investment. Check out 5 priorities for policymakers in this video and read our latest #IMFBlog for more details. https://t.co/LLDd21aLLx https://t.co/UEh6ieOPqI

IMF's @gwsokamoto at the 2021 #China Development Forum: Mutually-enhancing reforms will raise productivity and income, and lead to more balanced and consumption-driven growth. https://t.co/y9PqoIowfz https://t.co/K7UMrC9hjT

▶️REPLAY: One-on-one conversation with IMF Chief @KGeorgieva and @Microsoft President @BradSmi moderated by @MSNBC’s @alivelshi
for an exploration of how economists and technologists can collaborate to lay the groundwork for a better future. https://t.co/95d1WFMsgK

#IMFCountryFocus: Kenya’s economy is picking up speed after the COVID-19 shock, but the pandemic has left deep imprints on the country’s fiscal and debt positions. https://t.co/ccaWtNtRct #IMFAfrica https://t.co/tQXALGTXRS
Looking for the latest economic data about your country, your region, or about the global economy in general? Follow the IMF! https://t.co/LtZUpvMj1R
What is the latest economic data for your country? What policies are needed to reignite growth after a crisis? Stay up to date on important economic issues following @IMFnews. https://t.co/JrqgAwEJtv
Looking for the latest economic data about your country, your region, or about the global economy in general? Follow the IMF! https://t.co/8EOLKsGiQE

Check out our latest #WeekendRead newsletter on the future of Asia, Canada's carbon pollution pricing system, COVID-19 in the Caribbean, recovery in Kenya, cyber threats and much more:  https://t.co/AAOJjeiI8o https://t.co/Zelaa98ohH

Canada’s carbon price will steadily climb, which puts it on track to have net zero emissions by 2050, providing a model for other large-emitting countries to follow. #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/ZCpivBRQri https://t.co/J2sayfJH38
How does global warming affect demand for electricity? https://t.co/9ZcIzw3GwF https://t.co/gMx4j3P7tK

Mergers and acquisitions by big firms have contributed to the decline in business dynamism, pushing competitors to spend less on research and development. More on #IMFBlog. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ #MarketPower https://t.co/509cB8EARh

The IMF Executive Board encourages Canadian authorities to continue to use public health measures to combat the virus while maintaining adequate policy support. 

Read our annual review: https://t.co/G0AaXQGZ98 https://t.co/s9WEhuuU9a

The Coordinated Portfolio Investment Survey (CPIS) for end-June 2020 is now available. World holdings of equity securities showed a decrease of US$4.4 trillion while holdings of debt securities decreased by a lesser amount, US$1.1 trillion https://t.co/c1qMq454uH https://t.co/mR6R5HWCPh

COVID-19 exacerbated existing long-term issues in Asia-Pacific: slowing productivity, growing #debt, aging populations, and rising inequality. A new IMF staff paper looks into how the region can navigate these multiple challenges. https://t.co/z1je3CMwKT https://t.co/KiwOU04BKm

The Bank of Canada responded to the impact of the pandemic decisively by cutting its policy interest rate to an historical low and announced a range of programs to support liquidity in the financial system. https://t.co/8wTlbqKuQh https://t.co/xLUFBveXIi

Canada’s timely, decisive, and well-coordinated policy actions and ample buffers helped the country to contain the socio-economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/0En5gH2EG4 https://t.co/kWl15L8Ck6

The Canadian economy is projected to recover as the pandemic fades. The path of the recovery will be strongly linked to the evolution of the pandemic and the roll out of the vaccines. 

Read our annual review for 🇨🇦: https://t.co/OcNNRNCoAy https://t.co/H1YlmrUaDX

What do #IMFYouth Fellows say about how best to ensure a greener and more inclusive recovery after the pandemic—one that creates more jobs and opportunities for youth? Read about their ideas in #FandD: https://t.co/nI4uPkqwt7 https://t.co/7WjynfBu7L

STARTING NOW: A discussion with IMF First Deputy Managing Director @GWSOkamoto and winners of our 2020 #IMFYouth Fellowship Contest on the green and inclusive recovery and opportunities for youth. https://t.co/5H1GdXnr7m https://t.co/JYnVKTYBRc

The pandemic has accelerated digital adoption worldwide. But digital risks have also increased. Our new issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/hrp3RW3ffV

This pandemic might have long-lasting effects on Asia’s growth. A look at past recessions in advanced economies shows that 5 years afterwards output was still 5% below the precrisis trend. https://t.co/QF8P42r0ac https://t.co/WekAG8oxLQ

There is no magic “recipe” for developing a local-currency bond market, given the varying needs of each country. Our latest blog explains what countries need to look out for. https://t.co/3ve3MPnZNO #IMFBlog https://t.co/UP4VBE39oL
Having been hit by #COVID19 first, #Asia is also recovering first. At the pandemic’s first anniversary, is the region back to full health? https://t.co/uwiGwm7FSy https://t.co/iqkcusTvQk

🔴Don’t forget! Tomorrow at 2:30pm ET @KGeorgieva joins @BradSmi in a conversation moderated by @AliVelshi to explore how economists & technologists are collaborating to lay the groundwork for a better future. 

Watch live here: https://t.co/95d1WFMsgK IMFexchange

Join us tomorrow, March 18, at 9:00 AM ET, for a panel discussion between IMF First Deputy Managing Director @GWSOkamoto, and winners of our 2020 #IMFYouth Fellowship Contest. They will discuss the green and inclusive recovery and opportunities for youth. https://t.co/JYnVKTYBRc

Our new #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva looks at how to ensure that powerful corporations do not benefit at the expense of customers, workers, and governments in the aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ #MarketPower https://t.co/PjuwQCN5xS

Sierra Leone's education minister, David Sengeh, wants every child to have access to quality education. In a recent #FandD profile, @DSengeh describes why his country has linked education to its development agenda in an attempt to narrow inequality. https://t.co/5yKvK7ZzEb https://t.co/AC48nzBgvV

When governments in emerging and developing economies need money to pay for health, education, and other goods/services, they often turn to bond markets. Our latest #IMFBlog looks at why borrowing in local-currency might be better. https://t.co/3ve3MPnZNO https://t.co/s4c6Qh2YbZ

Join us on March 18 at 2:30pm ET when @Kgeorgieva joins @BradSmi in a conversation moderated by @AliVelshi to explore how economists & technologists are collaborating to lay the groundwork for a better future. https://t.co/JV8Dj5AAth #IMFexchange https://t.co/6N9ldET2MO

A warming globe could reduce the need for heating in cold seasons and increase the demand for cooling when it’s hot. What does this mean for #sustainabledevelopment? Read our #IMFBlog https://t.co/9ZcIzvM5F7 https://t.co/4Cp7xQ2RkT

Join us on March 18 at 9 AM EDT for a panel discussion between the First Deputy Managing Director, @GWSOkamoto, and the four winners of our 2020 #IMFYouth Fellowship Contest. What does the rising market power of a small group of firms mean for the global economy? 

Watch a replay of today's discussion with @KGeorgieva, @Vestager, @AmyKlobuchar, and other speakers. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ #MarketPower https://t.co/YGXsCQXqZJ

The IMF Executive Board today approved US$50 million for Sierra Leone to address the continuing impact of the COVID‑19 pandemic. This follows an earlier approval of US$143 million last year. https://t.co/WmrK8o0eOb #IMFAfrica https://t.co/U2Zvkvxra1

Sierra Leone's education minister, David Sengeh, wants every child to have access to quality education 📚. 

In a recent #FandD profile, Sengeh describes why his country has linked education to its development agenda in an attempt to narrow inequality. https://t.co/5yKvK7HYfB https://t.co/MVRjkgh9pD

Corporate #marketpower has risen in recent decades. New staff research suggests that the likely wave of bankruptcies resulting from the pandemic will further strengthen this trend. https://t.co/baj9LYJxho https://t.co/5YiRBKQkyF

Excessive #marketpower in the hands of a few companies can slow growth, stifle innovation, and hold back investment. Check out  5 priorities for policymakers in this video and read our latest #IMFBlog for more details. https://t.co/LLDd21aLLx https://t.co/3KWEPAOAHv

Our new #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva looks at how to ensure that powerful corporations do not benefit at the expense of customers, workers, and governments in the aftermath of the crisis. https://t.co/LLDd20TaTZ #MarketPower https://t.co/EQLWKOD852

STARTING NOW: Join us for a discussion on rising #MarketPower with @KGeorgieva, @Vestager, @AmyKlobuchar, @GuntramWolff, and @davidmwessel. Watch LIVE here:  https://t.co/gixfM2BD0D https://t.co/LbkrhTiOip

Join us on Monday, March 15 at 9:00 AM ET for a discussion on rising #MarketPower with @KGeorgieva, @vestager and @AmyKlobuchar, @GuntramWolff and @davidmwessel. Watch LIVE here: https://t.co/gixfM2BD0D https://t.co/LbkrhTiOip

The pandemic has accelerated digital adoption worldwide. But digital risks have also increased. Our new issue of F&D explores the digital future. https://t.co/mZENc2yjHL #IMFBlog https://t.co/6EZRJYeYf9

Growing #MarketPower of a small group of firms could undermine the recovery from the crisis. Join us on March 15 at 9:00 AM EDT for a panel discussion with @KGeorgieva, @Vestager, @AmyKlobuchar, @GuntramWolff, and @davidmwessel. https://t.co/gixfM2BD0D https://t.co/LbkrhTiOip

When governments in emerging and developing economies need money to pay for health, education, and other goods/services, they often turn to bond markets. Our latest #IMFBlog looks at why borrowing in local-currency might be better. https://t.co/3ve3MPnZNO https://t.co/UXVN7X6J0J

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath writes in the latest issue of #FandD that it will take a greater combined push of the scientific and medical community, governments, and multilateral institutions to avert a great divergence in prospects across countries. https://t.co/JdYhXiIIZD https://t.co/frxB1Ou2gm

With social distancing and health and hygiene protocols likely to remain in place, touchless service delivery and investments in digital technology could help the tourism industry recover. https://t.co/YffZJNAX4k #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/kZZ97nFB2i

In October 2020, The Bahamas leapfrogged into the digital vanguard with the launch of the world’s first central bank digital currency—the sand dollar. Learn more in the latest issue of #FandD: https://t.co/lW8qGLm7Xs https://t.co/6Sph8RF6Kd

When some firms have large and entrenched #marketpower, companies invest and innovate less, startups grow less, and workers receive a smaller share of income. Join us on Monday to discuss the implications for the global economy and what governments can do. https://t.co/LbkrhTiOip
One year on, here is how the IMF has helped its member countries address the pandemic. https://t.co/2TENLRGbAY #COVID19 https://t.co/nNYTFicg94

During this week's #IMFinnovation event @UniofOxford economist @carlbfrey highlighted that automation threatens many jobs, but history shows us that the normal economic churn will replace these jobs w/ mostly unforeseeable new ones. Watch the replay.  https://t.co/jM0CqedVSb https://t.co/B8kbJwQLan

There is no magic “recipe” for developing a local-currency bond market, given the varying needs of each country. Our latest blog explains what countries need to look out for. https://t.co/3ve3MPnZNO #IMFBlog https://t.co/ksE9WucBx3

The pandemic disrupted Sri Lanka’s historic tea industry, as live tea auctions could no longer be held. Technology helped update a 125-year old tradition in a matter of days, saving a vital economic sector. More in our latest issue of #FandD: https://t.co/lW8qGLm7Xs https://t.co/M7L2b0t3Uq

🎙@_RuchirAgarwal on embracing the gift of global talent: There is, at any given time, a small number of incredibly talented individuals that have exceptionally high ability to produce groundbreaking ideas." 

Listen to latest @imf_podcast: https://t.co/3684zKbq5t https://t.co/4gnzhu1dnn
In a #IMFBlog, @KGeorgieva outlines 3 actions to prevent people from being left behind as #inequality between and within countries rises as they slowly recover.
The crisis is leaving some people behind and widening inequality between and within countries. Here is what can be done to reverse the trend.
In a #IMFBlog, @KGeorgieva outlines 3 actions to prevent a dangerous divergence between and within countries as they move from crisis to recovery.

In recent years governments have been able to borrow more in their local currencies, which makes borrowing more stable and less risky for them. https://t.co/GSraSwagi7 #IMFBlog https://t.co/m2Gzm8mehF

When governments in emerging and developing economies need money to pay for health, education, and other goods/services, they often turn to bond markets. Our latest #IMFBlog looks at why borrowing in local-currency might be better. https://t.co/3ve3MPnZNO https://t.co/wB14hWGvMh
Catch up on the latest economic research, blogs, virtual events, publications, podcasts, and news from the IMF this and every week with the #WeekendRead newsletter. https://t.co/dwDSdR79kx

Growing #marketpower of big firms could undermine the recovery from the crisis. Join us on Monday, March 15 at 9:00 AM EDT for a panel discussion with @KGeorgieva, @Vestager, @AmyKlobuchar, @GuntramWolff, and @davidmwessel.  https://t.co/gixfM2BD0D https://t.co/L2BAzwEjsI
Has the COVID-19 crisis made big companies bigger and increased their #MarketPower? https://t.co/gixfM2BD0D
The global average for countries’ carbon price is around $2 a ton.  It should be $75; how do we achieve a just transition?  https://t.co/meiuT2yjVm https://t.co/DKC7yX4gn7

What lessons can we learn from the 20th century street lamplighters who lost their jobs due to automation? @UniofOxford economist @carlbfrey took us on a historical journey to better understand the impact of automation on future job markets. https://t.co/0UzYa5fkAo

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath writes in the latest issue of #FandD that it will take a greater combined push of the scientific and medical community, governments, and multilateral institutions to avert a great divergence in prospects across countries. https://t.co/JdYhXiIIZD https://t.co/zaIrrxKDNn

Building a new #climate economy requires three things: the right carbon price, green stimulus, and a just transition. Learn more about our work on climate change: https://t.co/ygjXJAjRYt https://t.co/snO49IOlcr

Expectations of inflation have remained broadly stable around the targets set by central banks, thanks to central banks’ independence and the credibility of their policies. Read more in @GitaGopinath’s latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/pEK3EsfgmR

The Spring 2021 issue of #FandD focuses on our digital future, exploring how we can redirect technology to spur more jobs, greater productivity, and a more equally shared form of economic prosperity. Read and download here: https://t.co/bZ9qfAig4a https://t.co/PMivrSKlTq

What’s a taxi riding app to do when a pandemic forces everyone to stay home? In Uganda, @SafeBoda quickly reinvented itself, connecting confined consumers with retailers and services. More in the latest issue of #FandD magazine: https://t.co/lW8qGLDJm2 #IMFAfrica https://t.co/LiZ53ysjbz

Indonesia suffered less from the pandemic than other Asia-Pacific countries, due to less stringent lockdowns and lower dependence on tourism. The country now has the firepower to boost its recovery. Read the IMF’s latest assessment: https://t.co/zIVfT0eabw  #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/JKFxtneKxz
Vietnam: Successfully Navigating the Pandemic. https://t.co/G4F0Y5HtmR #IMFCountryFocus https://t.co/wkMsTaygZ6

The pandemic disrupted Sri Lanka’s historic tea industry, as live tea auctions could no longer be held. Technology helped update a 125-year old tradition in a matter of days, saving a vital economic sector. More in our latest issue of #FandD: https://t.co/lW8qGLDJm2 https://t.co/5HEFvnKHya
